page.title: 01Area to the East of Ulpha
page.content: The area is mostly high fell, little population and scattered farms which employ most of the population. To the West is the Duddon Valley flat bottomed and steep sided containing farms with good hay pasture in the bottom and on the lower slopes rising Eastwards to rough enclosed pasture and then to open moor on the tops. East and West is divided by the Ridge of Brown Haw and Stickle Pike to the East of which lie a few farms some with good pasture but mainly poor. There is some forestry activity to the East of Stephenson and Carter Ground Farms. Public transport is restricted to the Post Bus carrying passengers as well as mail morning and evening Monday to Friday, evenings only Saturday. Some of the cottages and farms have been converted to holiday homes.
